data.PS: The following links are only valid for module list maintainers:
data.rationale:
The Black-Scholes model is the most widely-accepted way to value
    stock options. There really ought to be a reference implementation
    in Perl.

    I'm flexible on the module name. Unfortunately, "BlackScholes"
    violates the 11-char limit. Math::Business already exists, and
    seemed like a logical place. I'm calling this "beta" (even though it
    has been thoroughly verified) in case a name change is indicated.
